content:
Diagnosis:
04/2012 Limited stage small cell lung cancer, right lower lobe primary



- Completed induction chemotherapy with 6 cycles platinum/etoposide combination



06/2013 Progressive disease with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and local recurrence

Treatment:
09/2013 Completed second-line platinum/etoposide (6 cycles)

Current situation:
Assessment following completion of second-line therapy




Restaging imaging arranged

I reviewed [redacted name] in the Oncology Clinic today. She reports generally stable health with no new concerning symptoms. Her exercise tolerance remains satisfactory though she notes occasional dyspnea on moderate exertion. Her main current issue is an acute gout flare affecting her right ankle, currently being managed with colchicine and a reducing course of prednisolone.

On examination today, there is a persistent left supraclavicular node measuring approximately 2.0 x 1.8cm. The patient believes this may have enlarged over the past three weeks, though she is uncertain. No additional lymphadenopathy identified. Chest auscultation reveals decreased breath sounds at the right base but no added sounds. Cardiovascular examination is unremarkable. Abdominal examination shows no organomegaly or tenderness. No peripheral edema noted.

Given the possibility of lymph node enlargement post-chemotherapy completion, I have arranged urgent restaging CT imaging. Her fitness would allow for further intervention if disease progression is confirmed. Blood tests will be repeated today - noting her most recent hemoglobin was 9.2 which was clinically well tolerated.

We will review her in clinic in three weeks with the scan results.

cancer_timeline.value: Started induction chemotherapy with platinum/etoposide combination
Progressive disease with mediastinal lymphadenopathy and local recurrence

patient_facts.value: acute gout flare affecting right ankle
persistent left supraclavicular node measuring approximately 2.0 x 1.8cm
decreased breath sounds at the right base but no added sounds

status_updates.value: Limited stage small cell lung cancer treated with two lines of platinum/etoposide, now being assessed post-completion of second-line therapy with possible lymph node progression requiring urgent imaging.
review in clinic in three weeks with scan results
